p:
The genome and protein sequences of A. thaliana, O. sativa, Vitis vinifera, O. europaea, S. indicum, and Brassica napus were downloaded from the NCBI database. The hmmsearch program of HMMER software (version 3.2.1) ( http://hmmer.org/download.html) was also applied to the identification of TPSs (PF01397, PF03936) and FADs (PF00487, PF03405) in Pfam 32.0 data ( http://pfam.xfam.org/). To classify and investigate the phylogenetic relationships of the amyrin synthase-like, TPS, and FAD genes, the predicted genes were aligned using MUSCLE. Hence, two ML (maximum-likelihood) phylogenetic trees were constructed using RAxML software. The bootstrap test was performed with 1000 replicates to obtain high reliability of interior branches. The phylogenetic tree was imported to iTOL ( https://itol.embl.de/) for visualization
92 .
